formattedCourseData.title: Fundamentals of Adobe Premiere Pro
formattedCourseData.description: This course is designed for individuals looking to learn the basics of Adobe Premiere Pro for professional video editing. This software is a fundamental tool in the film industry, essential for any editor aiming to master the art of editing. The course will guide you through navigating the program's interface and its various tools, enabling you to create smooth and engaging videos.
formattedCourseData.whatyoulearn: In this course, you will grasp the fundamentals of video editing using Adobe Premiere Pro, including seamless transitions between scenes and adding visual effects and graphics. You'll also learn color correction techniques and audio engineering, as well as how to implement both basic and advanced animations. The course will provide you with a general understanding of editing techniques and how to export your film in high quality. Key Points You Will Learn in this Course: Cinematic editing techniques, Effective transition choices, Audio editing and mixing, Color correction techniques, Adding graphics and visuals, Utilizing effects for scene transitions, Finalizing and exporting your video in high quality.

Inserting, Editing, and Moving Clips - Insert with the Edit Key
Multiple Ways to Create a New Sequence
Trimming Clips from the Timeline in the Source Monitor
Editing Small Gaps in the Interview
Changing Relative Clip Content Using Slip and Slide Tools
Freezing Video to a Frame Using the Frame Hold Tool
Audio Adjustment - Audio Engineering for Clips and Audio Tracks
Starting to Work with the Graphics Workspace
Handles and Clip Properties in Premiere
How to Use the Color Correction Tool (HSL Secondary)
Step Five: Refining Your Raw Edit Technique
